greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,m) = binomial(2n-k+1,n+1) read by rows, 0<=k<=n.
comment: Obtained from A059481 by removal of the two last elements in each row followed by row-reversal.
Riordan array (c(x)/sqrt(1 - 4*x), x*c(x)) where c(x) is the g.f. of A000108. - _Philippe Deléham_, Jul 12 2015
formula: n-th row of the triangle = top row of M^n, where M is the following infinite square production matrix:
maple: A176992 := proc(n,k) binomial(1+2*n-k,n+1) ; end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Dec 09 2010
program: (MAGMA) /* As triangle */ [[Binomial(2*n-k+1,n+1): k in [0..n]]: n in [0.. 10]]; // _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 12 2015
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Dec 08 2010
